arabia.name: arabia
arabia.description: Open land map with scattered forests. Players start with standard resources.

strategies.early_game: Scout or archer rush is common. Walling is important but challenging.
strategies.mid_game: Transition to Knights, Crossbowmen, or unique units.
strategies.late_game: Control of gold and stone becomes crucial. Raiding is effective.

arena.name: arena
arena.description: Players start fully walled with a stone wall and gate. Encourages booming and late-game strategies.

strategies.early_game: Fast Castle or boom strategies are common. Early aggression is rare.
strategies.mid_game: Monk and siege play is effective. Building forward castles can be decisive.
strategies.late_game: Heavy siege and unique unit compositions dominate.

black_forest.name: black_forest
black_forest.description: Heavy forest map with narrow pathways. Encourages defensive play and booming.

strategies.early_game: Wall the choke points and boom. Early aggression is very rare.
strategies.mid_game: Control of the center and choke points is crucial.
strategies.late_game: Heavy siege and trash wars are common. Trade becomes very important.

islands.name: islands
islands.description: Players start on separate islands. Naval control is essential.

strategies.early_game: Fishing ships and dock placement are crucial. Galley rush is common.
strategies.mid_game: Control of the water allows for landing and expansion.
strategies.late_game: Naval control, trade, and landings determine the outcome.

nomad.name: nomad
nomad.description: Players start with villagers scattered on the map without a Town Center.

strategies.early_game: Finding a good TC spot and securing resources is crucial.
strategies.mid_game: Controlling water (if present) and expanding is important.
strategies.late_game: Similar to Arabia but with more scattered resources and bases.

gold_rush.name: gold_rush
gold_rush.description: Central gold piles with scattered resources. Encourages early aggression.

strategies.early_game: Control of the central gold is crucial. Early aggression is common.
strategies.mid_game: Maintaining control of gold determines the outcome.
strategies.late_game: If gold is depleted, trash wars become common.

fortress.name: fortress
fortress.description: Players start with a castle and walls. Encourages unique unit play.

strategies.early_game: Unique unit production and expansion are common.
strategies.mid_game: Control of resources outside the walls becomes important.
strategies.late_game: Siege and counter-unique unit compositions are effective.
